nodes.bodyText: In case the profile specified a canonical with a version, I used the same split as done in CodeGenerator to just compare the URL part.
seems a bit odd not to handle the element.is(Uri.class) in the if/else block with the others, but I suppose its fine
I kept the same if/else logic as used in the apply(...) method (around line 121) for expanded value sets to be consistent.  I can change both places if there's a way that would be better.

maybe just combine it with the method above and take an Element?
then you just need one if/else block, right?  maybe a "horse apiece" though.
Yeah, I went back and forth on that.  My goal was to minimize the number of lines of code to be added for any future syntax-based value sets (e.g. UCUM), so I thought this ended up looking cleaner.
I didn't know this was supported in our registry; interesting
I wonder if one of these should include the word MaxValueSet or ConstraintGenerator to make it clear what the test is for
Good call.  I'll rename these to be more descriptive.
this comment was very helpful for me, thanks
